CactusTool.carpet_scalar module¶

The cactus_scalars module provides functions to load timeseries in Cactus formats and a class ScalarsDir for easy access to all timeseries in a Cactus simulation directory. This module is normally not used directly, but from the simdir module. The data loaded by this module is represented as TimeSeries objects.

CactusTool.outputdir module¶

outputdir get all data file in a simulation directory.

CactusTool.outputdir.fetch_all_datafile(path)[source]¶

Only fetch the absolute path of .par, .asc, and .h5 file.

Args:

path (str): absolute path

Return:

list: All file in path.

CactusTool.outputdir.filter_file(files, file_style)[source]¶

Choose some file end with file_style

  • par: parameter file

  • scalar file

  • ASCII file

  • HDF5 file

  • checkpoints

CactusTool.outputdir.rm_output_active(files)[source]¶
Args:

files (list): A list of file in absolute path

Return:

A list of file, not contain output-dddd-active

CactusTool.outputfile module¶

The outputfile module provides most of the functionality of functions to deal with different type of files in Carpet format.

CactusTool.outputfile.HDF5_gf(file, slice)[source]¶

Fetch data in .h5 file Given slice

CactusTool.outputfile.HDF5_header(file)[source]¶

Return a dictionary about header information

CactusTool.outputfile.read(file)[source]¶

Carpet provides ASCII output and HDF5-based output for Carpet. These I/O methods can output any type of CCTK grid variables (grid scalars, grid functions, and grid arrays of arbitrary dimension). However, the data structure of I/O methods is completely different

Parameters

file (str) – data file

>>> with read(file) as f:

CactusTool.preview module¶

Create a pseudocolor plot

CactusTool.simulation module¶

simulation provides easy access to CACTUS data files.

A simulation directory is represented by an instance of the Sim class, which provides access to all supported data types.

class CactusTool.simulation.Sim(simpath)[source]¶

Bases: object

Basis class of CactusTool, anything start from it. Please use it attributes.

property Debug¶
property H5¶
property Par¶

It first read parameter file if it exist.

property Scalar¶

CactusTool.unit module¶

This module provides a class Units representing unit systems or unit conversions. All expressed in SI units.

CactusTool.visualize module¶

This module provides functions to plot various Cactus data types.
